metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2918 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An exploitable integer overflow exists in the Image loading functionalityof the Blender open-source 3d creation suite v2.78c. A specially crafted.blend file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflowwhich can allow for code execution under the context of the application. Anattacker can convince a user to open the file or use it as a library inorder to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

blender - 2.69.b+dfsg0-1
blender-data - 2.69.b+dfsg0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: blender package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.69.b+dfsg0-1').
